supporting_spans: The quartermaster made his preparations for departure, aided by the two sailors, one of whom attended to his horse, and the other to his provisions.
Ayrton suddenly sprang to his feet. In his hand was a revolver. A report was heard; and Glenarvan fell, struck by a bullet.
contradicting_spans: Ayrton suddenly sprang to his feet. In his hand was a revolver. A report was heard; and Glenarvan fell, struck by a bullet.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton/Ben Joyce adopted the alias Ben Joyce and formed a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey and second mate Eddie.

analysis.claim_text: After discharge he adopted the alias Ben Joyce and shipped on the Liverpool–Lisbon trader, forming a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey and second mate Eddie.

sub_claims.text: After discharge he adopted the alias Ben Joyce and shipped on the Liverpool–Lisbon trader.
He formed a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey and second mate Eddie.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton/Ben Joyce adopted the alias Ben Joyce and formed a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey and second mate Eddie.
